author: {'steamid': '76561198090117486', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1644916842}
review: Hey...you get to be bad arse Dr. Jones in the field.  sound effects are on the ball.. voice of Indy's character are cool..  I love any games associated with the the movies..the only challenge is getting the settings and controls to par..in combat indy seems stiff and sluggish...be patient and get used to the approach of combat...save your gun ammo for solo combat.  use the the whip and grapple thugs to a timely right hook by indy.  armed thugs should be quickly disarmed by the overhand whip..make sure to pick up weapons asap... if you are too close for grapple..slug it out until you can get some distance...a good game quirk...if you fall a bad jump...hit jump as soon as you hit the ground...fun game..gets borderline insane at the later levels...try and try again...

les dialogue sont pauvre et mal jou√©.

Review:
Pros:
- Good map design
- Music

Cons:
- Outdated

author: {'steamid': '76561198035632391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1615134589}
review:
At last, I beat it.  Ok, I only recommend this if it's something that brings you nostalgia, or if you think you would like a serious challenge when it comes to the level design of popular early 2000s titles.  That said, I enjoyed maybe the first half of the game.  Once I got to the Nazi u-boat, it got *significantly* harder.  It's like the game said, "You've had your fun.  Now, this is serious business."  The enemies suddenly became way too OP and bottomless pits became a frequent destination for Mr. Jones.  Eventually, it ended up being a huge chore and I almost gave up.

Recommended only to those people like that sort of thing.  I, for one, am not a masochist.  If you're looking for a casual retro gameplay, this is NOT for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198873594490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1669431274}
review: What a game. What an absolute masterpiece. This is one of the most fun and addictive games I have ever played. It is also a game I have fully enjoyed. The characters and the story is a great continuation for the Indiana Jones series. The gameplay is just terrifically created with parkour, obsticles, and my personal favorite, whip jumps. Combat is also another fantastic addition to this game's lineup. With this being my first Indiana Jones game, I very excited to play the earlier games, and as of January 2021, the future game! I would recommend this game to anyone who likes an adventure game like this. You don't even need to have seen the films to enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 2092, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1610862912}
review: I really love this game. I bought it back then and played it to the end despite some obviously flaws it has; first and foremost its really frustrating that there are too few save points so that you have to play a level over and over again; also the movement and camera controls are a bit clunky and the swimming parts are especially bad to control. Despite those flaws the game is just amazing: it is probably the only Indiana Jones video game that really has the look and feel of a true Indiana Jones movie. The level design is great, the fighting is in its comicesque exaggerations fun to watch every round a new and the music, sound and voice acting is superb; even the graphics have quite firmly stood the test of time. Give it a try if you haven't checked it out yet (if you have, you will obviously have already bought it anew): A really well done action-adventure.

review:
Este juego representa perfectamente lo que es Indiana Jones. 

Con su acci√≥n, la comedia t√≠pica de Indy, sus momentos √©picos entre muchas cosas.

Tambi√©n su apartado Extra de los tesoros es demasiado bueno y le da una buena re-jugabilidad, decir que para ser un juego de 2003 es personalmente muy perfecto eso, si tienen la posibilidad de comprarlo, haganlo. (con o sin oferta) el juego lo vale y muchisimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113182061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1610674557}
review:
Released almost 21 years ago, I'm surprised how well this game still holds up.  It does a great job of capturing the spirit and cheesiness of the original movies, and it's simply fun to play.  This game is a hidden gem.

The game does have a 30fps lock, but you can modify the game files to up it to 60.  I would also recommend getting the patch that helps run the game at your native resolution, as well as a patch for controller support.

https://youtu.be/7EqPXFTwuVc

review: Game makes me angry as hell but the Fighting and combat in this game is really good. The amount of multiple things you need to concentrate on is large and present in this game and you have to be fast in order to survive and move on. The thing that makes me angry most about this game is that once you fail or make one mistake it'll cost you the entire level and you'll have to do the entire level all over again. And once again each level you have to focus on multiple things making some of the levels hard. But this game was really cool for its time and even is now.

review: Playing this on the PC only makes me realize how incredibly broken the PS2 version was. Still nowhere near being the definitive Indiana Jones game - it controls better than the Infernal Machine and has superior combat, but that game had a better plot and more variety in its basic gameplay. Combining the two might make for something special, although I don't see it ever happening with the demise of LucasArts. Shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870130227', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 10490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1478, 'last_played': 1611355509}

O jogo no minimo pode durar 6 Horas mais jogando o jogo com calma pode durar umas 14 ou mais. o jogo possui diverso cen√°rios como selvas, bases, montanhas, templos etc. Este jogo com certeza contem uma variedade enorme de inimigos como ca√ßadores de marfim, agentes alem√£es, ca√ßadores de recompensa, samurais, almas mal√≠gnas, lutadores de Kung fu e principalmente os soldados nazistas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092351067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1614708312}
review:
The first time I got to play this game I was 8 years old. I had downloaded it as a demo off of a PC Mania (bulgarian magazine) CD. It had only a couple of missions, but they were insanely interesting to me so I would play them over and over. 
The game itself is one of the best of its time. Very well-made, with original score and average puzzles. Basically a perfect children's game. The interface and UI are clunky and the enemies not very intelligent, but that's all the bad I can think of. It's about the story, which is cool.

JUEGAZO de Indiana Jones con todas las letras. Para ser un juego de 2003 resulta ser incre√≠ble, lo he jugado en pleno 2020 y est√° genial, ya sea a nivel de gr√°ficos, misiones, historia,...

Lo recomiendo claro, si eres un fan de Indiana Jones. No te va a decepcionar para nada. El juego es una precuela de "El templo Maldito". Nos encontramos en China, 1935.

Lo que m√°s quiero destacar del juego b√°sicamente (y creo que es lo que todos los fans de la saga buscamos) es sentirnos en el mundo de Indiana Jones, en su piel. Y lo consigue, con creces. Desde la ambientaci√≥n (m√∫ltiples escenarios; Praga, Istambul, Shangai, Bases militaris Nazis, Templos...) las misiones con puzzles o batallas (a destacar, los puzzles son muy buenos, y el juego no se limita a solo liarnos a tiros), los efectos de sonido (eso ya es de ser muy friki, pero cabe decir que han usado los de las pel√≠culas, desde el l√°tigo, la pistola, los pu√±os,... etc etc etc. Incluso las respiraciones de Indy xDDD - y suma much√≠simo),... ¬°Y la m√∫sica! No est√° compuesta por John Williams pero lo parece, ya que coje fragmentos de las originales y las versiona para esta entrega, con un toque m√°s chino xD

Lo √∫nico "malo" son la jugabilidad y los guardados. No me malinterpret√©is, no tiene mala jugabilidad, solo que a veces cuesta dominar al personaje seg√∫n en que situaciones de tensi√≥n en las que hay que actuar r√°pido. Pero se le pasa, ya que es algo normal (¬°Estamos hablando de un juego del 2003!). 

Por otro lado los checkpoints: No se puede guardar partida. (Por eso he puesto que PUEDE ser dif√≠cil). Es decir, hay guardado autom√°tico, pero cuando pasas por un largo recorrido (demasiado largo) de misiones y enemigos. Es decir que si mueres, vuelves al principio. Puede volverse frustrante pero a la vez te hace ir m√°s precabido, y te mantiene m√°s en tensi√≥n, y si logras pasar de nivel es m√°s satisfactorio.

Tambi√©n hay alguna que otra referencia a la saga (si eres fan y te fijas bien). En conclusi√≥n, si eres fan de Indiana Jones no dudes en jugar a este juego, sin duda una obra maestra, y una historia que seg√∫n s√©, ES CANON, previo a la pel√≠cula de "El templo Maldito" de 1984.

Necesitamos m√°s juegos canon como este de Indiana Jones en la actualidad, que nos cuenten aventuras que vivi√≥ a lo largo de su vida. Y por otra parte, si no eres fan y no te importan mucho los gr√°ficos, es otro juego de aventuras que entretiene de principio a fin :) 

En conclusi√≥n, un gran juego, y lo m√°s importante, UN GRAN JUEGO DE INDIANA JONES. Con el cual podr√≠a hacerse una pel√≠cula (adaptando algunas partes, claro est√°).

-------------------------------

[b] ¬°Y por √∫ltimo! La traducci√≥n al castellano. Funciona perfectamente y es inst√°ntaneo: [/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1607148685

[G√©nero/s]

Acci√≥n, Aventura, Buena trama, Indiana Jones (SAGA), Puzzles, "Shooter".

author: {'steamid': '76561198150347720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1041, 'last_played': 1608755675}
review:
Une r√©elle d√©ception.
En tant que grand fan d'Indiana Jones, sinc√®rement, ce jeu ne lui fait clairement pas honneur et ne fait que le ramener dans l'ombre de Lara Croft... L'histoire est moyenne et les dialogues sont creux bien que l'on puisse appr√©cier une traduction fran√ßaise. Le protagoniste auquel on s'identifie pendant l'aventure ne fait que subir le sc√©nario du d√©but √† la fin en se faisant embarqu√© et men√© en bateau [spoiler](au mauvais jeu de mot) par les personnages chinois[/spoiler] ; ce qui ne met pas du tout en valeur un professeur d'universit√© et arch√©ologue aventurier... Avec une conclusion tellement b√¢cl√©e qu'elle en est presque insultante. Les √©nigmes sont d'une facilit√© d√©concertante et la jouabilit√© hasardeuse dans les phases d'action fr√¥le l'insupportable.

Une petite mise √† jour s'impose ?
En sortant ce jeu sur Steam, il aurait √©t√© appr√©ciable que la prise en charge d'une manette (Xbox 360 pour ma part) soit corrig√©e et adapt√©e, sans avoir √† trifouiller les fichiers du jeu.

Heureusement qu'il y a Docteur Jones et John Williams.
Les graphismes ne sont globalement pas d√©sagr√©ables pour un jeu sorti en 2003. La musique est forc√©ment g√©niale puisqu'elle n'est rien d'autre que celle des films. Ce jeu n'est valable uniquement parce qu'il poursuit timidement l'esprit de l'icone que repr√©sente Indiana Jones et ses aventures.

C'√©tait mieux avant.
Je conseille √† ceux qui pourraient h√©siter entre "Le Tombeau de l'Empereur" et "La Machine Infernale" d'opter pour cette derni√®re aventure sortie en 1999, faisant preuve de davantage de cr√©ativit√©. M√™me ci ce n'est pas un joyau, malgr√© des graphismes qui piquent un peu les yeux au d√©part et l'absence de traduction fran√ßaise, elle vous donnera certainement plus de frissons, vous chatouillera plus les m√©ninges, et cela avec une dur√©e de vie de jeu doubl√©e ! Ce titre l√† au moins avait de quoi faire trembler l'ego de Lara Croft.

3/10 - Soyons honn√™tes, ce jeu n'est pas du tout √† la hauteur du l√©gendaire Indiana Jones. Je n'ose m√™me pas imaginer pour ceux qui ne le consid√®rent pas comme tel !

Fran√ßois

author: {'steamid': '76561198008914127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1608224734}
review:
At first I thought I was going to like this game. It's like Tomb Raider, after all, Indiana Jones was the original! There's a variety of weapons and the ability to disarm opponents with a whip or use it to swing across gaps seemed irresistible. Indy can also do hand to hand combat unlike Lara Croft, and the locations were varied.

And that's when the fun stopped. The camera is far too sensitive and so you spend most of your time trying to work out what on earth you are looking at, and trying to direct Indy to do something which is actually useful. And then to cap it all off was a stealth level. Now if there's one thing which all Indiana Jones fans know, Indy is absolute rubbish at stealth. This game is no exception, I gave up for months. Finally I decided that the stealth was too painful and that the best tactic was just to try to run through the level as fast as I could in order to reach the exit. That worked. The game did not really get more fun.

As of yet I haven't completed it. Perhaps I never will. A fun idea made painful by terrible fight controls and movement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171651161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1607013470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1662857861}
review:
Awesome game.

I bought it for the nostalgia, having played the game as a kid but never finishing it.

The controls initially were stiff, and the camera was a nightmare at times, but after 30 minutes or so, I had gotten accustomed to both.

The game still makes you feel like Indy, the set pieces and story are fun, and the actual mechanics and charisma of the character haven't aged at all.

It remains a wonderful experience, that you should try specially because of its cheap price.

Just make sure to install the widescreen mod, and edit the vars.cfg file in order to get proper widescreen support as well as 60fps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027713442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1606548543}
review:
Pros:
+Fun and challenging adventure.
+Great use of the John Williams score as well as some good original music.
+Nice story worthy of the Indiana Jones name.
+Pretty decent Harrison Ford sound-alike.

Cons:
-Combat becomes an exercise in frustration in the later levels.
-Controls are okay, but at times very awkward and clunky.
-Camera is a hindrance in tight spaces.
-Why is Indy always panting?

While not one of the gems of the early point-and-click Lucasarts PC days, Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is still a fun and engaging action adventure game. Story is neat and flows just like the films (it also serves as a prequel to Temple of Doom), and it's filled with intrigue and thrills along with a decent Harrison Ford-ish sounding voice actor (the late David Esch, who also voiced Han Solo in the Star Wars Galactic Battlegrounds games). The game has a good mix of action, platforming, and puzzle solving, although the controls go from stiff and cumbersome in combat to touchy and awkward when you need to navigate narrow platforms and jumps. Speaking of combat, it's easy enough in the first few levels, but the enemy difficulty ramps up about halfway through and you'll find yourself taking many cheap shots and getting knocked on your butt constantly by enemies twice as agile and annoying to target and hit. Also, enjoy the sound of Indy's labored breathing, cause every time you run a few feet, jump, or attack he starts breathing very heavily until you stop for a few seconds. Still, I had a blast with Emperor's Tomb, and even with it's problems it earns it's place among the legendary Indiana Jones mythology.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321661586', 'num_games_owned': 1530, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 11524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1610867499}
review:
I first played with this game in like, I don't know exactly, probably like in 2006-2007 in my neighbours house, and I really enjoyed the game, obviously with a 6-7yrs old brain I don't understood sh*t about the whole game/story, but that was okay for me. I just played with it, because I liked the game and the character itself. I wanted to feel nostalgic, so I bought it, and finished the whole game for the first time. I am not gonna lie, it felt great. After all these years, I finally finished this game, and will never regret that. For me, it was worth the 5euro, since I have good memories with it. I recommend this game to those, who're already played the game back then, and liked Indiana Jones itself.

I want to see a Remake of this game, but sadly I know, that this will never gonna happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198932607209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2021, 'last_played': 1604789726}
review: One of the best games ever made. This game was made when developers actually cared about making a great game instead of just slapping the big name on it and trying to make a quick buck. There is not much to do after you beat the game the first time but this always will be a game you can back to later and still have a good time. This game is most certainly worth every penny they ask for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163182977', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1604228559}
review:
A surprisingly good game. The puzzles, even though there are less than I would have liked, are usually interesting and the "trap mode" could have been used more since it has a really cool feeling.

Once tweaked for XBOX gamepad support and fullHD resolution (I used this really quick guide https://emilio-gomez.com/indiana-jones-emperors-tomb/) I almost forgot I was playing a 17 year old game. 

This is what I feel Uncharted would have been if it had been released by then.

considering the original release date of this game, it's well worth a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072392025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1603003024}
review:
I felt like I got my value out of the 8 bucks it cost. A linear but mostly varied fun Indy adventure. Surprisingly good and responsive combat system with light/heavy attacks, blocks, counters, dashes, rolls, grabs and tackles that is good to play around with and makes for fun brawls. There's one particular bit where you have to time a jump in an air vent that is ridiculously hard, but otherwise the game is mostly easy, with a gradual rampup of difficulty towards the end. You can 100% it in 20 hours. Its main flaw is that it can feel a bit repetitive around the middle at times. Overall, pretty fun.

I'd recommend using an Xbox 360 USB controller to play this. The 360 controls are weird (top left trigger to walk, top right trigger to reload, start to cycle through your inventory, select to pick an inventory item, push in right analog stick to roll, push in left analog stick for start menu) but they work better than KBM. Reassigning the controls doesn't work properly, so it's better to leave the buttons as they're assigned.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982202609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1601169288}
review: My first review on Steam, ever. A fun little game that really captures the spirit of the movies. Graphics, sound, combat, all what you'd expect from a 2003 game. John Williams' score is treated with great respect. However, the swimming controls are essentially game-breaking, as you often have to elude crocodiles. On more than one occasion, after jumping into the water, Indy just floated there while my keyboard controls were completely non-responsive. Completely frustrating, especially so because if you die you have to start over on your quest segment. I love old games and am very patient, but after several failed swimming attempts in one particular segment with a one-shot croc, I bailed. Be warned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058731449', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1600959011}
review:
I first played this game on xbox classic when I was 8-9 years old, and at that time I stuck in one of final levels that I wasnt able to finish. Years passed and my xbox ended its life and I got into pc gaming. Replaying this game after 10 years is a leap into nostalgy.
After all I say this game is very adventurous with a interesting lore. 
There are bugs and annoying mechanics that will probably cause you to rage, but after developing a way and a method to play you can pass trough it with no many problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038399910', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1708270579}
review: Habe das Orginal auf CD-Rom, doch danke Win 10 kann ich es nicht mehr nutzen.Doch dank Steam kann ich diesen klassiker der Spielekunst wieder zocken. Wenn man die Grafik weg l√§sst, ist es ein gutes spiel. Sehr lange und auch sch√∂n herrausfodern. Halt in dem Indy stiel. Hatte es komplett durch gespielt und es ist jedes mal eine freude.

author: {'steamid': '76561198951815461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 64, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1712387681}
review: This game is still so fun and so good even after years of it being released. I have no regrets from buying this and will keep playing it over and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843952073', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1603631901}
review: I first played Staff of Kings about 5 years ago, and I never understood why so many people thought it was a bad game. But now that I have played Emperor's Tomb I totally understand. Emperor's Tomb is a really great game. It holds up surprisingly well. Fullscreen and resolution fixes are quite easy to find and install as well as removing the 30 fps cap.

review:

Only downside is the game mechanics are difficult to master well for me anyway as I died a lot haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198418258204', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1705976095}
review: This is an underrated and very rare gem of a game. We will most likely not see another Indiana Jones game for the longest time ever. If you ever wanted to be Indiana Jones and see what it's like to step into his shoes. This game gives you that. I'm deeply saddened there won't be another game like this. It is hands down one of my favorite action adventure games of all times. This game may be clunky at times but you'll overlook it. The MUSIC, if you're a fan of john williams, you'd surely enjoy this game as well! I mean who doesn't love hearing Indy's triumphant theme! Anyways, this is a MUST BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068357954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1663275246}
review: I really like the game as a whole. However, there is a glitch at the end of the "Ceylon" where whenever I try to get the Idol of Kouru Watu, I am unable to cut the vines and escape, thusforth rendering me unable to progress in the game. This is a very infuriating glitch and I have encountered no fix, even after scouring the internet.

review:
1 de los 2 juegos basados en Indiana Jones que copiaron la f√≥rmula de Tomb Raider. Personalmente lo considero superior a Indiana Jones and the Infernal Machine, simplemente por el hecho de tener una mejor banda sonora, sonidos y efectos que dan la sensaci√≥n de como si estuvieras dentro de una de las pel√≠culas originales.
Los controles son bastantes arcaicos y torpes, sobretodo en las secciones de plataformeo, y si a eso le sumas que tienes que rehacer secciones completas cuando mueres ya que no existen los checkpoints ni el salvado manual, entonces podr√≠a frustrar a aquellos jugadores que no hayan jugado Emperor's Tomb en su tiempo.

Solo recomendado para fans de Indiana Jones o nost√°lgicos, ya que dudo que el resto pueda soportar los defectos en la jugabilidad en √©ste juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277360881', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1663356661}
review:
Everything about the game is fantastic.
It may not be the best review that you will hear about this game, but here we go:

Story- "As Indiana Jones, you‚Äôll travel to 1935 China to prevent a powerful artifact from falling into evil hands. This globe-spanning adventure pits you against evil Nazis and the Asian underworld. It‚Äôll take more than just a trusty whip and pistol to avoid the perils of the Emperor‚Äôs Tomb."

Gameplay: 

Combat mechanics: Fun and good: You can use Indy's famous whip in order to pass many holes and complete many courses. You can also youse your fists to pucn enemies and also guns such as pistols, shotguns and even a Ray-gun.

Puzzles and level design: There are many puzzles sacttered in  Tombs and many more beautiful places that you'll visit, wich I'm not going to spoil for you, but believe me, they are amazing.

Villians and Bosses: The villians are interesting and they are some of the best I have seen Such as Nazis, sharks and many more. There are also a few boss fights and all of them are amazing, but I seriously don't want to spoil anything about them, some of them are special and quite unique. Every boss focuses on a different gameplay mechanic such as throwing, dodging and more and all of them also combine a few.

Secrets, Easter Eggs and Refrences: Every level contains a lot of secret artifcats that you can unlock and than beautifully display on the main hub, wich makes it satisfying and pretty cool.

There are also a lot of refrences to the movies, for example there is a really good sequence in Hong Kong that refrences the Shanghai Car chase sequence in Indiana Jones And The Temple of Doom wich is my favorite movie of all time. (Including the two other movies in the ORIGINAL TRILOGY of Indy, not including the 4th movie-Kingdom of The Crystal Skull wich is also great in my opinion).
And of course there are a lot more that I shouldn't spoil.

Final Verdict- Is it worth it?

Indiana Jones And The The Emperor's Tomb is one of my best experiences of all time and I'll never forget it. My first playthrough of this game was legendary and it's honestly unique and amazing! So is it worth it? Wether if you are an Indiana Joens fan or not, you should like it and even recognise some of the things from the movies, and if not you should enjoy it wether if you like Adventure and Action games like this one. I HIGHLY recommend playing it.
THE EASIEST 10/10 EVER.

I can definitely say that it's one of the best games I have ever played, and you should buy it even if you haven't played any games in this genre.

review: Played this with my mom growing up and it still holds up extremely well! Controllers are a little wonky to set up but follow the link at the bottom and there's a simple guide to help set it up. The old school Tomb Raider puzzles and combat are every bit as enjoyable as I remember. Downloading it on steam this year will probably be my 3rd play through of the game! This is a game I would recommend to anyone, casual or hardcore, Indiana Jones fan and not!

author: {'steamid': '76561198872993429', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 97, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1711819917}
review:
[h1] Indiana Jones¬Æ and the Emperor's Tomb‚Ñ¢ [/h1]

Um game com certeza incr√≠vel, de extrema qualidade que voc√™ deveria jogar. Eu descobri este jogo a muito tempo atras pois no meu antigo PS2 eu jogava (e muito) era [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/32330/LEGO_Indiana_Jones_The_Original_Adventures/] Lego Indiana Jones The Original Adventures [/url] e isso tudo aconteceu em 2012 quando eu tinha 6 anos (sim eu tenho 14 anos :/ ) e meu irm√£o falou comigo sobre este jogo foi tipo 'hey voc√™ sabia que tem um jogo de indiana jones sem ser lego para ps2?' sim foi tipo assim, eu n√£o sabia que era este jogo, Agora chega de historia e vamos para o jogo.

[h1] O Jogo [/h1]

A Gameplay do jogo e bem simples mais sutil, e o jogo contem 10 cap√≠tulos eu n√£o sei si isso spoiler ent√£o eu irei deixar marcado como spoiler [spoiler] Ceylon Prague Istanbul Hong Kong Peng Lai Lagoon Peng Lai Mountains Black Dragon Fortress Temple of Kon Tien The Emperor's Tomb The Netherworld [/spoiler] o jogo no minimo pode durar 6 Horas mais jogando o jogo com calma pode durar umas 14 ou mais. o jogo e bem divertido e diverso em cen√°rios como selvas, bases, montanhas, etc. etc. continuando o jogo tem alguns problemas como naturalmente rodar apenas em 30 FPS mais isso e super simples de si resolver [u] Momento Totorial [/u] e s√≥ voc√™ ir na pasta dentro da steam do game v√° na pasta indy e transformar a vars.cfg em txt e  s√≥ modificar o 'FPS rate 30 para 60' sim √© muito f√°cil qualquer um consegue fazer.

[h1] Os Inimigos [/h1]

Este jogo com certeza contem uma variedade enorme de inimigos como ca√ßadores de marfim, agentes alem√£es, ca√ßadores de recompensa, membros da tr√≠ade, e √© claro.... nazistas os malditos nazistas s√£o os inimigos que mais aparecem no jogo, acredite. temos outros inimigos tamb√©m temos cavalheiros?? sim cavalheiros.

[h1] CONCLUS√ÉO [/h1]

Bem eu n√£o posso falar mais nada por que muitas coisas do jogo est√£o diretamente conectadas com a historia ou seja eu n√£o poderei falar mais nada, mais se voc√™ esta procurando uma historia 100% diferente dos filmes essa e uma √≥tima escolha! sim eu j√° vi todos os filmes do indiana jones, e s√£o muito bons alias bem, agora √© hora da nota 155/10 um dos melhores jogos que eu j√° joguei!

review: Excelente jogo de aventura! Me lembro de jogar este jogo 10 anos atr√°s no Ps2, era meu jogo de aventura favorito na √©poca. Quando vi que estava dispon√≠vel aqui na steam, comprei na hora, mas fiquei com um pouco de medo de n√£o gostar mais do jogo depois de jogar jogos incr√≠veis com Uncharted. Felizmente isso n√£o aconteceu, o jogo continua bastante divertido! Diferente dos outros jogos de Indiana Jones, este √© mais focado em combate do que em puzzles. Ele tem seus puzzles, mas eles s√£o bem simples em sua maioria. O sistema de combate √© muito bom, √© bem massa sair na m√£o com os inimigos, usando seus punhos, chicote, garrafas, cadeiras, pernas de mesa, etc. O jogo tamb√©m tem um sistema de combate a dist√¢ncia, mas este √© mais simples, apesar de ainda divertido, e a variedade de armas aqui tamb√©m √© boa. Fora isso, o jogo √© focado em plataforma, que no geral funciona bem, exceto a c√¢mera que atrapalha um pouco. A ambienta√ß√£o tamb√©m √© muito boa, com √≥timas fases e lugares variados, exceto nas √∫ltimas fases, que achei pouco inspiradas.. No mais, o jogo √© uma √≥tima hist√≥ria de Indiana Jones que se passa antes dos filmes, como f√£ da franquia, √© uma √≥tima chance de jogar com o personagem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072127164', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1640448600}
review:
I really enjoy it when I discover old games on Steam. Not only do they add to the already enormous store page that we see here, but when you discover some old treasures, it brings back that sweet nostalgia. In my case, this game did exactly that. Way back when I had my Sony VAIO PCV-RX850 Desktop and a Windows XP operating system, I used to run this game on a disc. Remember back then when that's how you played a game on PC, before Steam Games?

As for the game, I would highly recommend it for people who already played it back in 2003. Being able to obtain this game again through Steam is a joy. As for you newcomers...

The game itself has decent graphics. The game was well made for its time. The story is well done and enjoyable. Not anything extraordinary, but quite the typical Indiana Jones story you would expect, with Jones visiting different areas of the pre-war world, having a female lead, encountering a rival, exploring ancient ruins and defeating Nazi's. 

Bugs are more common in games that were made in the age before paches, but I've rarely had any experience with bugs in this title. Well made game in overall. For those who can enjoy games regardless of graphics or complex gameplay mechanics, I would recommend cheking this game out. There are tons of YouTube videos about it, and I dare say that any true gamer will have a fun experience playing as the daring Dr. Jones on his adventure to find the Emperor's Tomb.

review:
Had a great time with this. The levels are short, but oh so satisfying when you unlock the exits or solve the puzzles and you get that classic tune kicking in to mark your success.

While the character model of Indy looks like his life is pain, I think it's fantastic that the developers added the hat animations. You'll see what I mean when you play.

A little frustrating with the controls to begin with, which also don't really operate in your favour at one particular segment towards the end of the game - but honestly, this is a brilliant addition to the Indiana Jones franchise.

review:
If you want your dose of 3D Indiana Jones Action/puzzle/platform game here it is. From the great company called LucasArts.

That is on a few conditions tho : there are section where the game simply becomes trial and error, and with no manual saving you are bound to replay ALOT of those levels. Also the graphics are kind of dated, and the controls take a long time getting used too. The game can crash alot too.

That aside it's still a great game and probably the last good Indiana Jones game made to date. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092973880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1584303514}
review:
A truly forgotten LucasArts gem.

Has it aged well? In some regards, yes, it still has a great story and it really makes you feel like you are Indy. However, there are some frustrating aspects of the game such as the camera and being unable to save mid-level.

I have memories of this game on PS2 and renting it from Blockbuster back in the day. I love it. And it was a pleasure to play through it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093386701', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1667828815}
review:
I played this game on the first xbox, and it was one of my favorite, and i remember struggling so much as a kid on this game
This game is still good today, all of the gameplay designs are good, fist-fight, platformer with riddles and hidden traps, a lot of differant weapons to use, until you get knocked down and an enemy grab your weapon to get vengeance
The fist fight is really the way to go, it's intuitive, with quick and heavy strikes, a grab, a lot of different combos; it feel brutal and in normal difficulty you're quite fragile, getting hit too much makes you vulnerable for the levels to come (don't forget to block, even in if caught in the middle of a combo, indy can recover after a few hit and will start blocking unarmed attacks, you obsiously can't block knives and machetes bare handed)
The atmosphere too is really good, it truly feel like an indiana jones adventure, the music, the sound effects, the cheezy humor, the plot is nice  even if quite forgetable but the levels design are really good (for an xbox of course, but it has not aged that bad i'd say)
It really feel like developpers tried their best to make a fun but not so easy game

Only downside are the absence of checkpoint during levels and a lot of (short) loading screens, but hey, makes it more authentic
I had a blast playing it again, but maybe it's just nostalgia
if you ever played a tomb raider and enjoyed it, you can enjoy this game in my opinion

author: {'steamid': '76561198345808911', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1651365473}
review: Surprisingly pretty good despite some jankiness with cameras and lack of saving within levels. Combat can be a little confusing and there are a lot of infuriating sections but with every death or mistake you learn a little more about a level and what to do which adds some rather nice feelings of progress once a level is completed. Stays pretty true to source material too, some supernatural, some Germans inexplicably in a secret base, pretty varied combat segments, platforming, and puzzles. All in all I recommend it if you can handle dying a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165213818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1689568564}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a fantastic game, albeit with some issues.  

Cons
Story: The plot is almost non-existent and it has little time for downtime.  The game is from 2003 and a 3D platformer/action game at heart, so this grievance is not unexpected, but it is disappointing.  
Saving: The checkpoint system is horrendous. You cannot save your game in the middle of a level, and you must repeat the entire section from the beginning if you die, or even more frustratingly, if you have to leave.  This point is fairly subjective, as it does add to the difficulty of the game, but I personally do not consider it worthwhile.  
Crashing: For whatever strange reason, the game crashes when minimized.  
Historical Representation: Prague is in Bavaria, the map borders in the cutscenes are from 2003, and the Turkish mercenaries are dressed more like Arabs.  These, and a few other nitpicks, might be minor to some, but they do sadly detract from the experience a bit for those looking for a bit more authenticity.  

Neutral
Underwater Controls: Controls for the water levels take a minute to get fully accustomed to, but they are not awful.  
Voice Acting: Mei Ying's voice actress, Vivian Wu, is absolutely terrible.  I am glad that they tried to be authentic by hiring a Chinese actress, but her English acting is terrible here.  David Esch does a decent job at capturing Harrison Ford's voice while absolutely nailing his demeanor.  The rest of the main cast are fine.  The voice acting for the German thugs is of a "so bad it's good" quality.  
Occult: The occult has been in Indiana Jones since the first film, but it was always kept to a minimum in the classic films.  Here, the more fantastical elements play a bigger role.  I would compare it more with the other two prior Indiana Jones titles "Fate of Atlantis" and "Infernal Machine" in regards to how far they take the more wild material.  I personally did not have much of an issue with it, but for those expecting nothing crazier beyond the ark or the grail, you may be disappointed. 

Pros
Gameplay: Platforming is fun and, from my experience, quite accurate with only a few jumps that felt unfairly punished.  Climbing feels intense but satisfactory to execute.  Combat feels stiff, but in a way that suits Indiana Jones.  As Indiana Jones is mid thirties and often fighting against people with as much (if not more) combat experience as Jones, the "dirty" feeling works extremely well here and replicates the films perfectly.  Puzzles are also sound and can provide some challenge while not feeling overwhelming.  
Locations: The areas picked for the game are all excellent, and I have zero complaints.  Outside of Xian and the titular "emperor's tomb," you get to travel everywhere from Istanbul to Ceylon to Prague to a Nazi submarine base and more.  
Graphics: For a game of 2003, the graphics look outstanding.  Compared to Lucas Arts other adventure game of 2003, Jedi Academy, it is absolutely impressive.  I would believe someone if they said it came out in 2006.  
Soundtrack: Possibly the greatest aspect of the game.  Even if this review does not sell you, I still recommend at least listening to some of the wonderful score that Clint Bajakian made for this game.  It captures the spirit of the films and John Williams style spectacularly while still being original enough to hold its own.  
Pricing: The game is $6 at the moment, which is asking for very little.  If you still do not want to spend so much on a game nearing 17 years of age, then a sale should hopefully drop it down to just a few dollars.  

Ultimately, while flawed, I would wholeheartedly recommend the game to any Indiana Jones fans out there.  While the story is not great, it nevertheless captures the spirit of the movies expertly, and it truly allows you to feel just like Indiana Jones.  Absolutely check it out if your curious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045420224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1580504495}
review:
The thing that I enjoyed about this game was finishing it. As someone who is an avid fan of Indiana Jones, I mean this from the best place in my heart when I say this game is absolutely terrible. The only way I could see this being worth your time is if you wanted to play this game solely for the purpose of nostalgia. Even then, that, in my opinion, should be a solidly debatable decision.

The whole game feels like a chore. The problems make game play extremely tiring. Sometimes enemies will annoyingly keep doing combo moves on you, and you're left there to sit until they're finished. Camera angles are some of the worst I've ever encountered. Want to walk against a ledge and look to the direction you're going? Nope. That would make sense; let's make it so you're looking at an angle that you can easily fall from. 
Would you like to save the game? You're at a pretty decent spot. No. You're going to have to complete the whole checkpoint, we want to make sure you lose all your progress in this particular section until you finish it in its entirety. Also, we're going to replay annoying-as-hell cutscenes every time you die. Sure, we'll let you skip them, but you're going to have to watch at least a few seconds of it. We want to make sure you're given at least a slight headache every time. 

Now, I get that the game is going-on-17-years-old, but it just doesn't hold up today, at all. I would love to see a well done Indiana Jones game sometime in the future, and this is definitely not one. It's a solid no from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140752892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1580010690}
review:
The word to describe this game is CLUNKY.

The story is CLUNKY. Its too fast paced with the connection between Indy and Mei Ling feeling very forced and unearned. Weird things that don't belong in Indiana Jones are littered everywhere. From genetic super soldiers to a LITERAL KRAKEN. The villains are cookie cutter with barely any personality.

The gameplay is CLUNKY. The basic moment to moment gameplay is fine but nothing special. The controls are stiff, making platforming terrible. Auto aim barely ever works even when your target is right in front of your target. There are some enemies that have combo moves that are super cheap. The death screen is super long and unskipable. 

The presentation is CLUNKY. It looks like a low res XBox game. The character models are nothing special with them not having that much emotion besides basic mouth movements. You can easily tell when the background begins. Music gets very repetitive. Indy breathes super loudly every 5 seconds which gets on your nerves VERY quickly. 

And the save system is TERRIBLE. There are no check points or manual save. You can only "save" progress every time you finish a level. So you can be near the end of a 10 minute level only to not jump correctly because of the controls and have to start the whole level all over again. Its the worst aspect of the game. That and the unskipable death screen.

Overall, not the worst game ever but definitely CLUNKY

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198883173711', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1610133161}
review:
This game is still a masterpeice after 16 years thats both amazing and sad.
Its amazing because the game holds up pretty well after 16 years and the mechanics are really good!
The sad part is that we didnt get a better Indiana Jones game after 16 years.
And its sad that this game is very underrated.
If you still somehow didnt play this game before you HAVE TO PLAY IT its amazing!
5 dollars for this game is WORTH THE MONEY!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103926212', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1647827390}
review:
If you've owned the game and you have fond memories of it then I would definitely recommend this game to you. Controls feel pretty alright, frame rate is locked at 30 and the resolution is capped pretty low too, it's a game released in 2003 after all, but it's a blast from the past.

If you have never played then I wouldn't recommend buying it unless it's on sale and you're looking for a game to burn 8 to 12 hours on. You may find yourself getting frustrated with camera controls and the platforming from time to time as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199005777655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1689609051}
review:
when i was a kid, i was obsessed with Indiana Jones. I eventually found out this game existed, but at the time, i didn't have any of the old consoles that the title could be played on. I was bummed, and always wanted to play this game. When I found it on steam, i was so excited and downloaded it instantly.

My review on it:
This game is marvelous. Considering the very few 3D Indiana Jones videogames, this one takes the cake for the best, and still is worth playing to this day.

Pros:
Fun gameplay
Ok graphics
Good control scheme (can be binded to your liking)
Good voice acting and sound affects

Cons:
Clunky swimming controls

Out of 10, I give this game an 8. Considering its only issue is clunky controls in swimming, this game is an absolute fun game to play, and will keep you busy for hours, and its going for a cheap price too. So get your hands on this game ASAP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198323460470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1575235721}
review:
Graphics and camera control are slightly dated now but still totally workable
There is a great variety in levels and the bosses are fun too
Normal difficulty poses a challenge and yet is not too hard to have fun with.
However some of the save points are very spaced apart so it can be frustrating having to lose lots of progress
Would give it an 8/10. Gives you that classic Indy feeling when the music kicks in!

review: Frustrating checkpoints, on top of the fact that when you accidentally press the windows key the game crashes. Also, sharks and gators are not fun and their AI is extremely weird. Everything else is pretty great. The combat is hard to get used to, but it's satisfying to master. Apart from the fact that you can't alt tab or anything, the game is pretty solid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099860224', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5551, 'last_played': 1647872811}
review:
As a child, one of my favourite passtimes was playing this game's levels over and over, just pummeling nazis for hours on end. The combat system is that good. When I discovered that this gem was on steam last year, I picked it up without a second thought.

As it turns out, 21 year old me still loves to play levels over and over to kill nazis with my bare hands. When I am bored and have nothing else to do, I know I can't go wrong with some IJET.

This game's amazingly fun. That's the word I'd use to describe it, everything about it is just so much [i]fun[/i]. The camera's a little clunky, and it uses a Dark Souls-esque control scheme by default (which I don't have a problem with, myself, but plenty of people do), but the platforming's fun and intuitive and the puzzles are interesting enough.

The combat system is, without a doubt, the best part of the game. I swear, this game has to have some of the most satisfying fist fights ever. Indy can do all sorts of punch combos that'll destroy his foes, throw enemies off cliffs or into walls (even into other enemies! Nobody misses out on the fun!), put them in a headlock and just pummel away, pull them closer with his whip for a punch to the nose, pistol whip them, use magical artifacts to eradicate ghouls... or, he can just shoot everyone. Guns are hopelessly overpowered in this game, and they're also not that fun to use, since the game has autoaim. I recommend just forgetting about guns and going with your fists the entire way. It's both more challenging and enjoyable that way.

Graphically, it's honestly pretty impressive for its age. It has mediocre resolution settings and a 30 FPS cap, but they're very easy to fix, won't take more than five minutes. There's a guide here on steam that explains how to do it, you cannot miss it. Once you've got it running at 60 FPS and at a tolerable resolution, the game almost looks five years ahead of its time. It also works magnificently: in my nearly 100 hours of game time on Windows 10 (notorious for breaking older games), I have experienced maybe one or two crashes during the gameplay - at most. 
[strike]The game does break when I try going to the desktop, but that might be an issue on my end.
[/strike]
EDIT (06/01/2022): At the time of writing, a member of the community has found a fix for this pesky bug. Look for the "Render Error Fix" guide here on Steam, by Doktor Headshot. It's a really simple fix and it works like a charm. Awesome work, Doktor!

This game's got no shortage of minor glitches, but I've yet to find a gamebreaking bug. Frankly, the glitches only add to the experience. At the time of writing (and if I didn't screw up the counting), I've got 74 screenshots of this game uploaded to my profile. Around 90% of those are of funny glitches that I encountered. My personal favourite is getting Indy to drink from a beaker full of acid. It may be just me here, but glitch-hunting's half the fun of this game. They're like nifty little easter eggs. Here's one you can try at home: operate a lever while you're drinking water from your canteen. Indy will pull the lever in a... rather peculiar manner.

As for the story, it's... all right. No match for Raiders or Crusade, but one thing I appreciate is that, rather than trying to emulate Indy's best hits, this game goes in a different direction. The story is, as a result, completely unique. It does get a bit ridiculous by the end, and the cutscenes are, sadly, the part of the game that has aged the most poorly. Still, the game feels like a real Indy movie, even if it's not as good as the real Indy movies, and I can commend them for that. Voice acting is pretty good, too.

Much like the story, the soundtrack, while a bit worse than John Williams's scores, is pretty kick-ass. Each area has its own leitmotifs, too, which helps give the locations their own identity. It's great stuff.

All in all, absolutely fantastic game. Fans of Indy will love it, I'm sure. For everyone else, there's the fist fights.

Now if you'll excuse me, I think those agents at Prague are needing their daily pummeling. Ha!

author: {'steamid': '76561198362932476', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1709930239}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197987116285', 'num_games_owned': 1869, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1568322203}
review:
Un jeu vraiment sympa √† jouer, avec Harrison Ford, la voix d'Indy (au moins en vf, s√ªrement en vo aussi), et les musiques qui vont avec ! Que du bon, on prend plaisir √† jouer :) jusqu'√† ce qu'on trouve l'histoire trop longue, parce que au final, on l'a vu venir, l'histoire, non contentes de nous faire bouffer du nazi, part dans les choux avec un aspect magico-√©sot√©rico-mystique... 

Et c'√©tait sans compter la cam√©ra d'√©poque qui peut s'av√©rer super p√©nible, les s√©quences de plateform-ing qui peuvent parfois √™tre super reloues, et cette impression que la fin du jeu est b√¢cl√©e, les s√©quences finissent par s'encha√Æner sans cin√©matique de changement de pi√®ce, on comprend plus vraiment ce qui se passe, √† un moment le m√©chant nazi resurgit de nulle part une derni√®re fois, puis quelques niveaux improbables, et paf ! c'est fini !!!

Oui, l'histoire a des longueurs et des aspects qui ont fini par me saouler, mais je recommande quand m√™me de jouer ce jeu, c'est un des meilleurs Indiana Jones, apr√®s les 3 premiers films !! ;) ;) ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1556428630}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Ja (pers√∂nliche Wertung: 6/10)

Errungenschaften: Nein

Positiv:
- Indiana Jones
- Gute Story

Negativ:
- Plumpe Steuerung
- Zu wenig Speicherpunkte --> Frust

Fazit:
Na da ist mir ja mal ein Schatz in die H√§nde gefallen! Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb ist ein klassisches Abenteuerspiel. Was f√ºr mich anf√§nglich aussah wie ein dahingeklatschtes Spiel, welches parallel zu einem Film erschienen ist, entpuppte sich als einen kurzweiligen Spa√ü. Zu der Story sage ich nichts, da jeder sich selbst davon √ºberzeugen sollte das diese gut gelungen ist.
Das Spiel hat nat√ºrlich auch so seine Macken... Die Steuerung ist manchmal etwas plump, die Grafik ist auch nicht die sch√∂nste und die rar ges√§ten Speicherpunkte sorgen an mancher Stelle zu Frust. Ich will nicht wissen, wie oft ich von ein und dem selben Krokodil gefressen wurde... Dennoch kann das Spiel mit einigen Spielmechaniken gl√§nzen, von denen heutige Spiele sich etwas abschneiden k√∂nnen. Der gr√∂√üte Pluspunkt ist jedoch dieser: Indiana Jones! DA DA DA DAAAAA DA, DA DA DAAAAA DA, DA DA DAAA DAA DAAAAA DEEEE, DA DA DA DA DA... Kurz gesagt: Ein gelungenes Spiel und definitiv Empfehlenswert!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062739674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1635750187}
review:
[h1]"Ch'in Shi Huang, First Emperor of China. Hmm... looks pretty good, all things considered.[/h1]
[i]Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb[/i] was a real trip down memory lane. It is a very nostalgic game for me, having been one that I played for countless hours when I was a kid. I saw it for sale for a pretty paltry sum, and decided I might as well play through it again! I found, to my delight, that the game was actually much as I remembered it - the first few levels are definitely the best, there's a sudden difficulty spike as you reach Istanbul, and the later levels of the game range from tough and atmospheric - I remember they used to be even scary - to bland and forgettable. There's a series of Nazi submarine base levels that are just wandering through hallways and punching Nazis in the face, which is fun for a while, but when there's little meaningful platforming or even the light puzzling the game offers, then the game becomes a drag. But mostly, the level design is on point, and the fist-fighting is probably the second best I've seen in a game, just behind [i]Batman: Arkham[/i].

[b]Gameplay[/b]
You play as the legendary Indiana Jones - before the events of any of the films - but still a hardened explorer. It is a third person action/adventure game in which you can shoot, leap, interact and punch. The shooting is generally done via auto-aim, though there are one or two on-rail turret sequences and you can go into the relatively ineffective first person mode. The platforming can be pretty finicky, though it really is just something that takes getting used to. 
By far the highlight of the gameplay segment is the brawling and fist-fighting. Using the left and right mouse buttons, you tell Indy to swing. Hammering them both at the same time grabs the foe by the collar and you can smack them around a bit, throw them off ledges, into tables, or just kick them in the groin, toss them to the ground, and kick them some more. Indy is a pragmatic fighter. He makes use of table and chair legs, bottles, or just chairs themselves, as well as his trusty whip, which he uses to disarm the variety of Nazis or cultists that he finds through the story. 
You collect and manage a relatively small inventory, and heal yourself by collecting medkits and refilling Indy's trusty canteen of water. 
There are some swimming sections, which would be pretty boring if they weren't invariably inhabited by the most terrifying crocodiles in video games, and sometimes sharks too. 
It's worth noting that the puzzles are generally pretty easy - could have been a lot more challenging, but that's okay. It keeps the game moving along and the pacing generally feels tight.  
All in all, the gameplay still holds up very well to this day, and if you're a fan of Indiana Jones, this game really does make you feel like Indiana Jones - every *thwack* is infinitely satisfying. 

[b]Story[/b]
While it certainly isn't an award-winning story, and inferior to the first three movies, I always thought that this game's story could be adapted and revised for the big screen instead of what we got in the [i]Crystal Skull[/i]. Indy is recruited to find the artifacts that will lead him to the First Emperor of China's tomb, and you go all over the world in suitable Indy fashion - from Ceylon, to Prague, to Hong Kong, all the locales are visually very distinct and the levels can be challengingly designed, although generally fair. The story carries on at a rapid pace, as discussed earlier, and there are a few revelations, though nothing you can't see coming. There's one weird cutscene just before the final boss that's kind of weird and unexplained, but other than that, I really do like the story. I would have liked to have seen more Mei Ying in the Indy mythos later on.

[b]Graphics, Sound and Atmosphere[/b]
The graphics are pretty dated by now, of course - all you have to do is look at the screenshots to see that. But honestly, the character models are all distinct, recognizable and the locales all have their own art styles. There is a fix for the resolution online, too. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1618326824]Check out this great guide.[/url]
The sound is just really amazingly good. The Raider's March kicks in at just the right time during the combat, and the atmospheric stingers are distinct and recognizable. The voice acting is pretty good, too - some of the time. Other times, it's pretty stilted and weird. Another reason I would have loved for this story to be adapted to a big screen or even just re-invisioned or remastered. 
The atmosphere makes you feel like Indiana Jones, exploring ancient tombs, punching Nazis, cultists or escaping angry wildlife. It's great. It's just great. If you want to feel like Indiana Jones, even if just for a few hours, play this game. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
It's a game that makes you [i]feel[/i] like Indiana Jones. And I mean, how else can I sell this game? In a world that's sorely lacking in Lucasarts games - I mean, why are there such a distinct lack of [i]Star Wars[/i], [i]Indiana Jones[/i] and all these other great IPs games? It's honestly just pretty sad. In the mean time, play [i]The Emperor's Tomb[/i]. It's fun, it's B-movie esque, it's all those Indiana Jones tropes you've come to love and expect. 
Go ahead. 
Punch a Nazi in the face. You know you want to.

review:
Um jogo que recomendo, mas apenas para f√£s do Indiana Jones, pois tirando isso n√£o √© um jogo que envelheceu muito bem, principalmente na parte dos controles, que s√£o um tanto imprecisos. Outra coisa que vale mencionar √© a falta de variedade de falas do Indiana Jones e dos inimigos, quando voc√™ pega um item explosivo por exemplo, ele s√≥ tem duas frases, que s√£o: ''I'll try to not blow myself up'' e ''Boom'' e ao menos pra mim, foi algo que no come√ßo achei engra√ßado, por√©m mais para o final do jogo me incomodou um pouco.

 Os inimigos tamb√©m tem pouqu√≠ssimas falas, eles geralmente falam sempre as mesmas coisas, s√≥ mudando a l√≠ngua j√° que h√° fases em pa√≠ses diferentes.
A parte gr√°fica achei boa, n√£o √© o melhor gr√°fico que tinha quando saiu pra ps2, mas consegue ter alguns ambientes bonitos. 

Os controles, como mencionei antes, s√£o bem imprecisos, especialmente nas fases que tem que nadar, fazer isso no teclado e mouse √© horr√≠vel, voc√™ se confunde com frequ√™ncia, e quando tem inimigos te perseguindo ent√£o, a√≠ √© que as coisas fodem de verdade. Outra coisa em que a imprecis√£o dos controles afeta bastante √© o combate, que √© muito bom com exce√ß√£o disso, mas √© f√°cil errar golpes no jogo porque o Indiana Jones n√£o sabe onde bater, foram v√°rias as vezes em que eu acertei o nada ao inv√©s do inimigo, e claro, √†s vezes acertava o inimigo quando n√£o era para acertar.  

O tiroteio eu achei ruim, se no combate era comum errar golpes, aqui, parece que o Indiana Jones tem algum tipo de estrabismo, porque ele erra tiros at√© quando os inimigos est√£o na frente dele, e apesar disso no come√ßo do jogo n√£o incomodar muito, perto da reta final do jogo vai, pois a muni√ß√£o vai se fazer muito necess√°ria para avan√ßar. √â comum tamb√©m ver inimigos resistindo √† tiros de espingarda, mas isso √© proposital. 

A dublagem √© outra coisa que achei ruinzinha, o Indy com certeza n√£o √© dublado pelo Harrison Ford e a qualidade do √°udio tamb√©m n√£o √© boa, a atua√ß√£o tamb√©m n√£o √© das melhores, mas relevei por conta da √©poca em que foi lan√ßado, mas senti que faltou emo√ß√£o em algumas falas. Ao que parece o jogo teve um baixo or√ßamento.

Apesar desses pontos que citei, √© um bom jogo, o primeiro em que eu vi o chap√©u do Indiana cair e voc√™ poder pegar ele de novo, o que eu fiz com muita frequ√™ncia, pois lembrava muito o filme e d√° uma sensa√ß√£o boa ao pegar, por√©m h√° uma coisa engra√ßada, que, se voc√™ pausar o jogo, o chap√©u do Indiana Jones some durante a tela de pause, sabe se l√° porqu√™.

O combate, que eu havia mencionado antes, √© muito bom (quando se acerta os inimigos), √© poss√≠vel fazer uma pequena variedade de combos, entretanto as anima√ß√µes para eles s√£o bem feitas e a rea√ß√£o dos inimigos √© boa, fora que eles tamb√©m s√£o espertos, eles se defendem, pegam armas do ch√£o, te agarram, pegam cobertura (isso durante o tiroteio) e at√© te derrubam e roubam a sua arma.

O que tenho a elogiar do jogo, al√©m desses detalhes, √© que ele realmente te faz sentir como o Indiana Jones, o que para a √©poca em que joguei, foi algo que me deixou de boca aberta, por conta da liberdade que o jogo proporcionava, j√° que voc√™ podia explorar o cen√°rio como bem entendesse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157453094', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1563737244}
review:
Not just one of the best licenced videogames of all-time but one of the greatest adventure games ever made. Indiana Jones And The Emperor's Tomb is everything you could possibly want from an Indiana Jones game and more. I'm a big fan of the Indiana Jones movies (especially the first three) so it's great to play another great title from LucasArts that really does the series justice.

You play as Indiana Jones as you embark on an epic quest that has you trekking across the globe, visiting places including Prague, Istanbul and Hong Kong. Each location is broken up into several shorter missions. The design of these is absolutely terrific as it combines the action, the puzzles and the platforming. It does a better job than any of the Tomb Raider games that I have played of blending together all three elements into a satisfying experience. This is as close as you are going to get to playing an Indiana Jones film.

Each environment looks unique and the enemies you face are also specific to each location. Expect to fight gun-toting Nazis in Prague, Arab swordsmen in Istanbul and martial artists in Hong Kong. The fighting is very fun with lots of different combos and animations as you take down your foes. You can also use an array of weapons such as guns, glass bottles, chairs and of course, your trusty whip.

I really like the way the health system is handled as you can heal yourself by drinking water from your canteen and this can be refilled at various fountains. You can also find health packs dotted around the game.

You need to keep an eye out for secret areas if you want to find all the artefacts.

The music is terrific as it is taken from the excellent John Williams score from the movies.

The graphics are very impressive for a game from 2003.

My only complaints are very minor and most can be forgiven due to the age of the game. A few of the environmental textures look very ugly and Indiana Jones' face looks a little bit off but that might have been due to some form of legal issue surrounding the use of Harrison Ford's likeness.

Also, I dislike how easily you can be hurt by fall damage. It seems every little fall will take health away from you.

This is an amazing game that you definitely need to check out if you are a fan of adventure games or the Indiana Jones franchise. Even the menu in this game is terrific. I have played other Indiana Jones games such as the Lego Indiana Jones games and the point-and-click Fate Of Atlantis game but this one is easily the best. I would love to see an official remastering or even a patch address some of the texture issues.

Gameplay: 9.5/10
Graphics: 7.5/10 (for the time)
Controls: 8/10
Replay Value: 8/10

review:
[h1] La place d'Indiana Jones et le Tombeau de l'empereur est-elle dans un mus√©e¬†? [/h1]

Si aujourd'hui les jeux d'aventure ne jurent que part Lara Croft et Nathan Drake, fut un temps o√π Indiana Jones avait une place de choix dans ce domaine. D√©sormais rel√©gu√© au rang de simple ic√¥ne dont les fans ch√©riront le souvenir, le professeur Jones est n√©anmoins revenu sur Steam pour nous faire profiter une ultime fois de sa derni√®re aventure.

[u][b] Un respect de l‚Äô≈ìuvre originale... [/b][/u]

Entre les fans de la trilogie de Steven Spielberg et les gamers (ou profanes) ne connaissant pas ou peu le c√©l√®bre aventurier au chapeau, il y a fort √† parier que les fans de la trilogie y trouveront sans nul doute leur compte. Le jeu reprend tous les √©l√©ments qui ont fait le succ√®s des films, en mettant en sc√®ne des nazis convoitant un myst√©rieux artefact chinois, le tout servi par les musiques de John Williams et la voix fran√ßaise d'Indy.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777495819

Le jeu adapte avec brio certains objets phares des films. Le fouet d'Indiana est ainsi synonyme de phase de plateforme et son revolver de gunfight. Comme tout bon arch√©ologue qui se respecte, Henry Jones voyagera √† travers le globe, de Hong-Kong √† Ceylan en passant par Prague.

Le jeu se paie m√™me le luxe d'introduire quelques personnages des films, et de se composer comme le prologue du Temple Maudit. De quoi ravir, √† n'en point douter, les amoureux de la trilogie.

[u][b] ‚Ä¶ au service d'un jeu simplement correct [/b][/u]

Indiana Jones et le Tombeau de l'empereur comblera de bonheur les fans, cela ne fait d√©sormais plus l'ombre d'un doute, mais quid des joueurs venus humblement chercher une plaisante exp√©rience d'action/aventure¬†?

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777496345

Ces derniers risquent d'√™tre un brin d√©√ßu. Le sc√©nario reste simple et convenu, la faute √† des cin√©matiques trop peu nombreuses et des personnages caricaturaux, peu d√©velopp√©s.

Le gameplay est quant √† lui en demie-teinte. Les phases de plateforme sont hasardeuses, avec un Indiana Jones qui ne va pas toujours o√π on le voudrait, glissant alors b√™tement dans un gouffre mortel. S'agissant des combats au corps-√†-corps, ceux-ci sont plaisants, √† l'inverse des gunfights, durant lesquelles il faudra mettre de c√¥t√© une quelconque strat√©gie au profit d'une attitude plus muscl√©e.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777496946

On notera √©galement l'absence de checkpoint, chaque ¬´¬†gamer over¬†¬ª entra√Ænant avec lui l'obligation de recommencer le niveau depuis le d√©but. Frustrant, quand on sait que certains passages sont particuli√®rement longs. On appr√©ciera n√©anmoins le fait de parcourir des niveaux vari√©s. Enfin, s'il est regrettable de constater l'absence de v√©ritables d'√©nigmes (les rares que l'on peut consid√©rer comme telle ne solliciteront qu'une poign√©e de neurones), il sera toujours possible de se consoler en cherchant les artefacts diss√©min√©s √ßa et l√† dans les diff√©rents niveaux du jeu.


Ainsi, si cet Indiana Jones et le tombeau de l'empereur restera une exp√©rience plaisante pour les fans, les ¬´¬†simples joueurs¬†¬ª risquent de se retrouver face √† un jeu oscillant entre le moyen et le bon, dont les d√©fauts risqueraient de les faire d√©crocher en milieu d'aventure, les chapitres 5 et 6 (sur les dix que composent le jeu) √©tant les plus mauvais et les moins int√©ressants.

[code]Vous avez aim√© cette √©valuation? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de r√©daction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les pr√©f√®re froids.[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074845294', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1560699479}
review:
TLDR: much nostalgia, adventure vibes, indy voice, some levels are fun, but usually the shortest ones X the worst controls in the history of gaming, the other levels, frustrating checkpoint system

I gave Indy an approval. BUT. mostly out of nostalgia. Back in the day, when the game came out, I beat the demo in hong kong theatre a dzillion times. And I was about thirteen or fourteen years old. And I loved it. Im an Indiana Jones fan, I like the atmosphere and the adventure vibe the series has. And it also looked great back in the day too. I bought it here, and aside from the resolutions needed to be fixed and stuff (which I dont mind - I am well aware of the games age) it worked fine, I was overhyped in the first hour or so. Then I just found out this is not a good game. Sure it has its fun parts, but the levels are boring, sometimes utterly ugly, I enjoyed Indy looking like Indy and voice sounding pretty much like Harrison Ford. But right from the beginning I couldnt believe how frakked up the controls and camera angles are. I died a lot because of it. Sure sometimes because the section was hard, but like 90% of my reloads was because Indy fell somewhere because the controls messed up or camera turned somewhere for no reason and Indy followed that direction and not the one I pressed. I gotta say I played a lot of games and never in my adult playing career was I so frustrated as when playing this game. Because in combination with stupid checkpoint save system, sometimes you gotta repeat like ten fifteen minutes of gameplay just because the controls killed Indy. Too bad. I enjoyed some parts and finished it. But then I went off Into the wilderness, because I had to calm my nerves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044293868', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1560292640}
review:
A nice piece of nostalgia. And yes, the alligators still scared the shit outta me. Took about 11 hours to beat it, with a couple irritating parts. Definitely worth the full $6, or wait for a LucasArts sale.

- no issues with changing the resolution
- only crashes if you try to tab out, not a single crash otherwise
- you could probably use a third party to set up controller support, but the basic 'partial support' is missing too many buttons to use from the get go, keyboard and mouse controls work fine

author: {'steamid': '76561198125869086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1560069932}
review:
Besides Tomb Raider, this is the worst port of an old game I've ever played on Steam. Here are just some of the issues.

- The game crashes when you tab out or when the game is minimized.
- No windowed mode.
- The game crashes when you change the SCREEN RESOLUTION.
- There is game pad support but the default controls are completely nonsensical.
- There is NO D-PAD INPUT! Which means you use the PAUSE button to cycle through weapons by default. You cannot assign the D-Pad buttons to cycle through your weapons like you could in the ORIGINAL GAME on PS2 and XBOX. WTF?!

Poor show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083531248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1610503722}
review:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1618326824]How to run this game in whatever resolution you prefer[/url]

Not much more I can say that has not already been said. This is the best Indiana Jones action game that I've ever played. Fun playthroughs in various environments and some tomb raider style puzzles to go with it. This game is only $5.99 on steam. Well worth the price if you love this character and universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798492460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1663200076}
review:
The game is pretty good considering how old it is. Aside from the irritating camera angles and the occasionally awkward control scheme, the games hand-to-hand combat is satisfying. There is gun combat too, yet it isn't as developed and thought through. Platforming and exploration is quite linear but also well made, making you have to time your jumps and co-ordinate your plans unlike something such as uncharted. The games puzzles are relatively simple also.

Overall, the game is a fun short experience similarly to that of Uncharted or Tomb Raider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095196168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1554675080}
review:
>be me
>be 7
>Mom and dad are constantly fighting
>often can't stay in the same room together
>Christmas 2004
>Dad buys me a xbox 
>Mom buys me a bunch of games
>Open Indiana jones and the Emperors tomb
Dad: "Why did you buy him that? hes 7 he doesn't know what indiana jones even is.
Mom: "well i thought it would get him interested."
>try to play the game, buy im really too young to get it
>parents take over to help me
>mom and dad acually work together to get me through the first half
>i just sit enjoying the action and music and stuff
>parents eventually get back together some time later when little bro is born
>would go on the play the game for the next 3 years until i finally beat it.
>would go on to enjoy the good indiana jones films

>be me
>23 typical pc master race gamer
>kinda a depressed young adult with a alcohol dependency
>none of my regular online friends are on
>drunk browising the store for a cheap single player, 
>see Indiana Jones and the emperors tomb has a steam release
>heart skips a beat
>instantly buy it
>play if for the next 3 hours
>be genuinely happy for the first time in years
>Call parents, tell them how much i love them
>didn't black out on a friday night for the first time in months 

and im still playing it, stuck on that asshole squid just like the good old days, thank you lucus arts for this horribly underrated early 2000s gem, it will always hold a place in my heart as one of the deepest gaming experiences of my life. lets hope EA never tarnishes it,
