author: {'steamid': '76561197983290992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1552015176}
review:
Finally! Took you long enough, Disney! But I still hate you, though.

This is a very underrated gem of the LucasArts era. A flawed masterpiece for us to hold near and dear to our hearts, made by fans of Indiana Jones to fans of Indiana Jones. I was introduced to this game when bought the film trilogy, and a trailer for this game was in the DVD with the extras. I had enjoyed a lot "Infernal Machine" on the N64, and as I moved on to PC, I bought this game for computer. And now, I decided to add it to my Steam library to revisit - to see if it still held on. And it did.

The game is a very demanding platformer, to the point it may focus more on precision over fluidity. And naturally, you use your whip to swing between platforms, because it wouldn't be an Indiana Jones game without it. 

It is clear by playing the game that developers put a strong emphasis in combat. They wanted the game to be something of a brawler, as you take on multiple enemies at once. Of course you have your guns and all that, but ammo is not that plentiful, meaning you'll get into melee combat here and there. The main issue however is that you'll see a lot of enemies being tossed in, and it gets to the point combat becomes repetitive and a little boring. But at very least, combat is fluid and not cumbersome in the least.

The level designs are the best the game has to offer. They are intuitive to solve, and this is all I ask from my adventure games: that the puzzles are not so simple to the point they might as well not be included, but that they can be solved organically, by just observing the envirioments thoroughly and deducing what the next step is. The levels, obviously, have their share of collectables, but they are not so worthy of a detour from the main path. It would be nice if they would grant you cheats - and apparently, the XBox version had cheats, but I wouldn't know anything about that in this PC port.

The graphics actually aged very well, and they really convey the places and era they represent. The art team did a fantastic job in creating those envirioments that are really immersive and impressive, but unfortunately the resolutions are in 4:3, meaning you'll have to put on with those black sidebars (unless you find some mod, but I don't want a widescreen this badly). Plus, the game seems to have poor anti-aliasing, but thank God it runs smoothly, without crashing. Meanwhile, the soundtrack is somewhat disappointing, feeling very bare and bland, like a low-budget attempt to mimic John Williams' iconic compositions for the films.

The story wants to bring Indiana Jones to the Far East - somewhere he's never been in the movies other than the intro for "Temple of Doom". So naturally, they made the game into a prequel to the movie, and (spoiler alert, I guess) at the end of your adventure there's a segway for the beginning of the film.

For fans of Jones, this game is a must, and fans of platformers and puzzle games should also give it a try, for there is much to value here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035356224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1588001857}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a third-person action-adventure game developed by The Collective, Inc. and released by LucasArts in 2003.

I am heavily biased with this game, I'll just admit that right now. This was one of the first games I played on the PlayStation 2 at the time. I remember my dad buying it at launch in June of that year and it was one of the prettiest games I had ever seen at that point. being able to just run around, climb, swim, whip over gaps, and solve puzzles was just a fantastic feeling at the time. I wasn't aware of the Tomb Raider games at that age, but from what I recall, my dad sure didn't like the controls.

Gameplay is simple Third Person affair. Get to the end of each level. There are 10 chapters, with each chapter having multiple levels/sections between them in which you traverse areas such as jungles, dungeons, astrological bell towers, aquatic ruins below Turkey, mountain bases, chinese forts, and the end of the game which takes place in a literal different dimension. Playin' as Indiana Jones you can punch the shit out of goons, grab em and toss em around, use your whipe to snatch weapons from enemies hands, or just pull your gun out and kill the fuckers cold style. Along the way you will be solving puzzles, which aren't too intensive and provide a nice balance to the action. 

Despite it's age, the game is very connected and good fun. I'm not gonna be one of those polygon or ign writing "it really makes you FEEL like indadad jodes", because that's obligatory from a title bearing the title characters name. No this game just feels like a good adventure. The game takes place before the events of Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, ends with the events that precede said film. Voice Acting is hit or miss for most people now a days, but it's serviceable, and David Esch, who takes over the character from veteran Doug Lee, (who voiced Indiana Jones in previous LucasArts titles "Fate of Atlantis" and "The Infernal Machine") does a good Indy. The music is absolutely great and captures the spirit of the franchise.

This really is just one of those games that is a product of it's era. On sale it's a dollar. Def a good experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069668522', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1613479824}
review:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor's Tomb is a 3rd Person beat em up adventure game where you play as Indiana Jones who is trying to Recover all 3 Pieces of a Mystical Artifact called The Mirror of Dreams, The Mirror allows its user to navigate their way safely through the mysterious Emperor's Tomb, Indiana is battling against the Nazi's who want to Obtain the Heart of the Dragon to control the will of Men and gain unlimited Power. 

For a game made in 2003 the Graphics aren't so bad and some of the levels may actually look quite pretty at times, Prague, Hong Kong and Ceylon are some good Examples. Textures and Models are really good too and animations are superb, really giving you the feeling that you are kicking the Sh*t out of your enemies with over the top punches, cries of pain and grunts. 

Aside from Fist Fights you'll also be able to obtain a good variety of weapons such as Luger's, Mauser's, Grenades and the MP40 to name a few which can give you (And your enemies) the edge in combat, Indiana also has access to his Iconic whip which aside from being used to swing to different areas or make enemies back off can also be used to disarm your opponents of their weapons. There are multiple ways to approach each fight and there are a lot of combo's you can do, my personal favourite is shoving a Baddie off a ledge where they'll then fall to their death. 

While not as amazing as the films the Soundtrack in this game is definitely very well done, from the awesome menu theme, to the jungle like soundtrack of Ceylon to mystical horror music when you're in the Emperor's Tomb the Music really gives a great Indiana Jones Atmosphere and i have listened to it on Youtube several times, playing this game without Music turned on is a Mistake, crank it up! 

You'll travel to a variety of locations in this game such as the jungles of Ceylon, the Abandoned castle and dungeons of Prague and more, each level is quite memorable and has their own special chapter which is fun to replay, some levels even have Artifacts which are usually hidden or out of the way from your main goal, collecting all Artifacts will unlock a Special Surprise which i won't spoil. 

Voice Work for the most Part is decent enough, The Voices of your Enemies are often fun to listen to as they call out for backup, taunt you or say funny preset idle voice lines, While Harrison Ford does not voice Indiana in this game the Voice Actor; David Esch (Rest in Piece btw :'( ) Does a very convincing job of sounding just like him, as a Kid i actually had no idea that it wasn't Harrison Ford and i felt a little silly, the Voice Work of the other Characters aren't amazing but they are good enough. 

The Game however is not without its issue's, While much better than the Xbox Original and PS2 Versions the Camera at times can be shoddy especially in tight areas where you need to jump to a rope or ledge and this can get you injured or killed which is annoying, and also the game has some texture glitches which are extremely frequent in the Emperor's Tomb Chapter and the Animations at that point and voice work sometimes is shoddy as well, either it was overlooked or the game at that point was being rushed, its mild issues but still issues all the same. 

Another issue is that the game is quite easy, i'd highly recommend playing on Hard to get a more enjoyable experience, although easily beating the as*es out of your enemies on Easy is still very enjoyable, I've heard that the Black Pearl mod heavily increases the Game's Difficulty but i have not played with that mod. Also this game has a LOT of swimming, i don't find this as big a Criticism as some other people do but its still annoying and the swimming controls are really terrible, moving your mouse at all will throw off your view and will get you stuck, this is a big problem if a Shark is after you as well.

But overall if you're a fan of Indiana Jones there is almost no reason why you should not grab this game, its cheap and has a good length and if you like retracing your steps to obtain artifacts the length of this game would be increased even more so, This game truly makes you feel like you are Indiana Jones and its a damn shame how underrated it is, grab it for full price on Steam and i guarantee you will have an excellent time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080304734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1677120746}
review:
Before I bought and played this game on Steam, I had bought this game for my father back in 2004 for Father's day. I was a little kid, 6-7 years old, with Indiana Jones as my hero growing up. I played this game with my dad several times, but what was left in my memories until now have faded so much. 

Buying this game now, downloading it, and playing it. Probably the greatest amount of nostalgia I have ever felt. Soon to be 21, It is INCREDIBLE how much my brain remembers from this game. Almost every single thing I have encountered thus far I CAN REMEMBER from when I was a kid. 

This version of the game works great, with a minor tweak to the fps the game functions just fine on my rig. I am more than happy with the performance. The graphics aren't all that bad either. Gameplay takes a little getting use to but simple once figured out. 

Many who have never played this game would have a tough time running through it due to the fact it hasn't aged well when compared to modern games. But the game is still worth a playthrough, regardless if it is for pure nostalgia or just out of the love for Indiana Jones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1546123540}
review:
[code] Hay disponible una traducci√≥n al espa√±ol (Espa√±a) [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1607148685][u]AQU√ç[/u][/url][/code]
[code]Puedes ver m√°s rese√±as como esta en la mentor√≠a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta rese√±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Menuda sorpresa me he llevado con este juego. No lo jugu√© en su d√≠a cuando sali√≥ al mercado en 2003 y tampoco esperaba demasiado, aunque s√≠ ten√≠a cierta curiosidad por jugarlo para ver c√≥mo era, y la sorpresa ha sido may√∫scula. No lo he podido soltar hasta que no me lo he acabado, y la experiencia ha sido m√°s que notable.

Este juego de Indiana Jones bien podr√≠a ser una pel√≠cula m√°s dentro de su repertorio, ya que posee un gran argumento al estilo de las pel√≠culas del famoso arque√≥logo. 

Situ√°ndose cronol√≥gicamente antes de la pel√≠cula ‚ÄúEl Templo Maldito‚Äù, en esta ocasi√≥n Indiana Jones tendr√° que recorrer medio mundo siguiendo los pasos de un misterioso artefacto relacionado con el primer emperador chino. Un artefacto que est√° rodeado de misterio y tras el cual est√°n un misterioso grupo chino y el ej√©rcito nazi.

Gracias al planteamiento del guion, podremos visitar gran cantidad de escenarios, a cada cual m√°s variado. Desde la selva amaz√≥nica hasta china, pasando por Europa y Oriente Medio. Toda una aventura llena de retos y acci√≥n.

Una de las cosas que m√°s me ha gustado de este juego es que mantiene un equilibrio perfecto entre el plataformeo, los puzles y la acci√≥n. Esto √∫ltimo me ha parecido de lo mejor del juego, ya que los combates a pu√±etazos est√°n realmente bien hechos, y se consiguen un n√∫mero muy variado de combos seg√∫n como alternemos los golpes.

Tambi√©n me ha gustado bastante la parte plataformera, ya que los saltos, las escaladas o el buceo estar√°n a la orden del d√≠a para encontrar el camino que nos permita seguir avanzando. Menci√≥n especial para el uso del l√°tigo de Indiana, el cual est√° muy bien implementado, saltando de un lado a otro en multitud de ocasiones mientras nos balanceamos en √©l.

El tema de los puzles tambi√©n es bastante interesante, aunque por lo general no son demasiado complejos, y a poco que nos esforcemos hallaremos la soluci√≥n sin quebrarnos demasiado la cabeza. Aunque eso no quiere decir que no sean exigentes muchos de ellos y que no est√©n muy bien implementados.

El aspecto gr√°fico tambi√©n me ha sorprendido bastante, ya que no esperaba demasiado de un juego de 2003, pero he de admitir que el juego se ve bastante bien y aguanta muy dignamente el paso del tiempo. Desgraciadamente, el juego no soporta resoluciones widescreen de base, pero una vez que est√°s metido de lleno en la aventura, te aseguro que eso ser√° lo √∫ltimo en lo que pienses.

La parte sonora, por otro lado, tiene un nivel excelente. La m√∫sica es simplemente sensacional, con los temas de esta saga sonando durante toda la aventura, y las voces est√°n muy bien implementadas igualmente, con buenos actores de doblaje.

La versi√≥n de Steam no incluye el espa√±ol, sorprendentemente, pero si visitas el enlace superior de esta rese√±a, podr√°s ver una gu√≠a donde podr√°s descargarte un archivo para poner el juego en espa√±ol, tanto textos como voces.

En definitiva, este juego me ha parecido una maravilla. Toda su propuesta me ha resultado tremendamente entretenida, con acci√≥n y exploraci√≥n a partes iguales y una historia muy aventurera al m√°s puro estilo Indiana Jones.

No te dejes enga√±ar porque sea un t√≠tulo de 2003. Este juego atesora una gran calidad en su interior, y a buen seguro que todo fan de este tipo de juegos lo disfrutar√° enormemente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992722927', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 110, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1711315609}
review:
This was my childhood game, I'm surprised it even came out on steam! I've been modding it since forever till I switched to windows 10 and lost everything.

Now for a review.

Best game ever.

Ok for real,

The game was made in 2003, of course the graphics won't look as pretty as before,
but in my opinion it's still pretty good for a 2003 game.

Gameplay
- The gameplay is simple, it's like most platformers puzzle games and all that, but what shines in this game,
is the combat mechanic. The hand to hand combat is amazing, You have two buttons, one for right arm and left arm, and combining those two making different combos, some that I've never seen before, is very satisfying. Plus you have that block and dodge mechanic for defense. For the gun fights, it's pretty simple, just target and shoot. Dodge bullets take cover, but the cover system feels wonky compared to others like Uncharted. Also, There is no checkpoints. Which is awful in some levels that are really long then you die at the end, which is very possible in this game.

Story
- The story is good enough, I mean I might be wrong, cause I don't really remember it. I'll keep it spoiler free for people
who haven't played it yet. Yes a spoiler free review for a 2003 game I know... The story goes like an Indiana Jones movie basically, Indy searches for a lost treasures and deals with Nazis and obstacles in you way. But, since it's an Indiana Jones story, Things don't go as planned.

Some problems and fixes
- Now for people who are lazy to check the internet for solutions and write a bad review saying, gaME nOt wOrKiNg! bAd!
Here's a few solution for ya

30 FPS Lock
- For people who are annoyed by it (including me)
1. Go to the game's install directory 
2. Go into GameData > indy 
3. Find the file called 'vars'. 
4. Open it in notepad 
5. The 'FPSLimit' option is pretty close to the top - set the value to 60 instead of 30. 
Apparently you may cause an audio desync in the cutscenes, but I've never experienced that, so who knows
source: https://www.gog.com/forum/indiana_jones_series/indiana_jones_and_the_emperors_tomb_tweaks

Widescreen problems
- Just download this mod, there's no virus, trust me.
https://www.moddb.com/mods/moviesloading-screens-fix-full-screen-1280x960

gAmE's tOo eASy!
- Well I've felt that before and I've found a wonderful mod made by Andrashi
https://www.moddb.com/mods/ijet-dragon-pearl-mod/downloads/dragon-pearl-mod-v10
Basically it makes the game harder by improving the enemies AI, making bullets more rare and by making them more realistic, meaning that you will die. A lot. It also makes you stress when someone holds a gun and points it towards you. Or is that only me?

gRaPhiCs aRe aWfuL
- Well, I was working on a retexture mod making the game look more decent. I'd have to restore everything I lost and it's gonna take me a long time, also because I'm lazy.

Needs more memes
- HA you're in luck! Go see my youtube channel if you want to know more about my cancerous mod I was working on, and if you want it, well go cry on your bed cause I'm done with it! :D
Ok seriously, as soon as I got everything I'll begin to work on it. While I work on it, well feel free to make some yourself, I've left a really bad edited video explaining how I did it, so go watch it if you want!

My youtube channel
- It's very shitty I know
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEUYgf_BPNTwAjr__H38dvg?view_as=subscriber

author: {'steamid': '76561198092558233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1545717311}
review:
Has not aged well whatsoever. Get this game for the nostalgia, not for the gameplay.

Update: after five hours of playing this buggy garbage, I wish I could downvote this game twice. This game has no redeemable qualities aside from nostalgia. The controls are absolutely horrendous, the camera can be uncontrollable at times, making you take leaps of faith some times. The combat in this game is extremely exploitable: just use hand-to-hand combat and spam the hell out of the LMB and RMB. Jumping can be broken at times; sometimes Indy won't jump when you press the Spacebar, and other times he'll bang off a wall and fall to his death. Swinging from chains/ropes is also broken at times; he won't swing forward, just backwards.

Awful addition to an otherwise pretty solid series. I don't remember it being this God-awful. Stay far, far away from this game, even while it's on sale.

P.S: I know it's from 15 years ago, but some of this shit is inexcusable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078530844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1545300259}
review:
‚ÄúDON‚ÄôT call me Junior!‚Äù (C) IJ :)
Ah, nostalgic :) Just finished it. Great game of my childhood about favorite adventure cinema series.
For 2003 it has some nice details. Hat that Indy can loose and pick up using action button, throwable objects, different walking animations depending on water level you are going through. Typical IJ jokes in cutscenes.
Overall I like it very much. Could not finish years ago because of a bug. This version is ok. Got a "serious" bug only once - could not use inventory. Also Alt+Tab crashes the game.
Basically it's Lara Croft from the world of men :)
One serious downside for me: when you die - you have to start the level from the very beginning. Good thing - levels are short.
But I think there is a place in hell for those who made 2 levels: The Path of Unseen Peril and The Pillars of the Underworld. I hate when you fail just on the last jump. Such games always need manual saves imho.
Buy it even not on sale - it's very nice and plays great anyway. Just use widescreen fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072729121', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1545148080}
review: This game remains the best Indiana Jones game ever made. The campaign is good and fun. If you're an Indy fan, this is for you. The Emperor's Tomb story is original (not adapted after one of the movies) and it feels like one of the 3 Indy classic movies, just a bit watered down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190747133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1545102691}
review: This was awful. The controls are flimsy and loose, the camera is floaty, the game is buggy, the CONSTANT (And I mean literally whenever you press a movement key) breathing from Indi is the most annoying thing I've had to deal with in a game in a long time. DO NOT get this game. I have no idea how it has all these positive reviews.

review: Ich habe wirklich nichts erwartet und es damals auch nicht gespielt, aber dieses Spiel ist wirklich toll. Es ist √§hnlich wie die alten Tomb Raider-Spiele, jedoch etwas actionlastiger. Allerdings sollte man sich davon nicht t√§uschen lassen, denn die Sprungeinlagen sind teilweise wirklich anspruchsvoll. Ist halt ein Spiel der alten Generation. Es gab (f√ºr mich) ein paar nervige Stellen im Spiel, da die Steuerung etwas gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig ist. Ansonsten ist die Atmosph√§re wirklich gro√üartig, es ist in deutscher Sprache und vor allem es lief bei mir unter Windows 10 einwandfrei. Windows 10 ist ja bei alten Spielen immer so ein Problem. Zuletzt noch nat√ºrlich der faire Preis erw√§hnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001490367', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1543898406}
review:
[b][h1] ‚Äú15 Years later of Fortune and Glory‚Äù [/h1][/b]
Back in the day when LucasArts published quality games, one of them was Indiana Jones and the Emperor‚Äôs Tomb developed by The Collective in 2003. Follow the story of archeologist named Dr. Henry Walton ‚ÄúIndiana‚Äù Jones, action heroes of 1930s film and light novels who travel in great journey for mysterious artifact and fighting against corruption and Nazis force.

---------------------------------------------------------
[h1]To the Land of Dragons[/h1]
The story of the Emperor‚Äôs Tomb takes place in 1935 before The Temple of Doom film of franchise. Dr. Jones receives an assignment from Chinese officers to retrieve ‚ÄúHeart of the Dragon‚Äù of the first Emperor of China ‚ÄúQin Shi Huangdi‚Äù before it falls into evil forces. The journey leads you to various locations from Prague great castle to the Peak of Penglai Mountain in China while things are getting complicate. I‚Äôm appreciated the connection between location and story. There are some decent cutscenes to engage storytelling and voice acting does great job to represent Dr. Jones aside from the films. Each NPC also have their mixed English voice and their native languages which are nice touch. The Emperor‚Äôs Tomb might not have mind-blowing twist compared to films and novels, but it keeps you engaging at the end of each chapter to the end.

The game music is created by various composer and orchestra team. Classic Indiana Jones theme is never get old along with mixed theme for each location and in-game event. The sound design in both exploration and combat are great. Give clear sense on what you‚Äôre approaching. 

---------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Exploring The Hidden World[/h1]
The Emperor‚Äôs Tomb is an action adventure game. It‚Äôs a second installment that applies fully 3D characters and gameplay. It involves around beat em' up combat, climbing, and logical puzzles. There are 10 locations in campaign. Each one divide into 10-15 mins sub chapters. Because of short chapter, there is no checkpoint or manual save. The game only saves between ends of chapter which encourages you to play smartly especially on hard difficulty. There are collectables hidden in some levels which rewards you with concept arts.

The climbing and jumping is considered old type adventure game where you‚Äôve to face in right direction before perform action. Your character will simply climb up as you move forward or jump in right direction, but you can‚Äôt changes direction when moving on mid-air. You mainly progress through complex level by reading environment and perform some special moves (rolling, swimming, and swing across ledge by your whip). Some levels contain traps and puzzles, but it‚Äôs quite easy to figure out as the cutscene and environment will gently guide you. Thanks to well level designs and some amazing visuals.

---------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Beat Em‚Äô Up or Fight with Tools[/h1]
The Emperor‚Äôs Tomb also heavily focuses on combat which offers very fun and engaging combat. You mostly encounter human type enemies with different weapon, combo, and fighting style. In close combat, you attack with combination of left and right mouse click creating various combos. You can grab enemy by pressing both left and right click and perform special move such as uppercut and pushing in direction. Your whip can disarm enemy‚Äôs weapon, create distance in fight, or even drag enemy neck and give a blow to their faces. Combine with environment and various melee weapons, it creates raw brawling gameplay and satisfied feedback (you can make chain collision between enemy characters which is hilarious). Whenever you take damage, you can quick heal by using medkit or running and drinking canteen which can be refilled from wall fountains in level.

The game also offers decent gunfight and a lot of firearms from classic crossbow to MP-40 machine gun; your character will automatically aim to nearest target. It lacks of lock-on option and higher rate you fire result lower accuracy. Otherwise, you need to aim manually in first person view by holding C which is not quite convenient. Yet, it‚Äôs still fun and chaotic especially when dealing enemy group.

---------------------------------------------------------
[h1]A Quite Rough Journey[/h1]
I found The Emperor‚Äôs Tomb runs smoothly in modern hardware with few tweaking in few minutes (higher resolution than 1280x760, uncap framerate, wildscreen fix). Variety of enemy type and reaction (pick up weapon when they‚Äôre unarmed, push you to ledge, counter attacks, run to cover). The major problem I found is camera issue. Camera sensitively swings when player rotate camera around tight spot. There‚Äôs few difficult spike on some levels. Also, there is rare case when player is not allowed to move up when grabbing ledge, force player to drop as the game has ridiculous indicator of height for fall damage (You take damage where you drop from same human height platform). Alt-Tab during chapter run will instantly crash the game, but opening task manager works fine.

---------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Verdict[/h1]
The Emperor‚Äôs Tomb might have some outdate technical design and more action packed than previous title ‚ÄúInfernal Machine‚Äù. But for 2003 game, it‚Äôs amazing and fun adventure which doesn‚Äôt need trendy modern gimmicks to support its original complexity. It holds something special in my childhood which modern adventure games probably miss. I highly recommend to all action adventure games.

[quote][i]If you found this review helpful, please consider and give a thumb up or feedback to improve my review[/i][/quote]

review: Truly exellent game! The controls are as smooth as it gets and the graphics were ahead of its time! It really makes you feel like Indiana Jones. Switching items is a little wonky and it seems you are only allowed to shoot enemies, even though you are given a machete and a whip, but the game makes up for it as you are granted auto aim! Super helpful! Here's a little summary of the game(spoilers!): In Indiana Jones¬Æ and the Emperor's Tomb‚Ñ¢, you play as Indiana Joes going through the Emperor's Tomb. Now that's a story if ive ever seen one! I really can't recommend this game enough, one of the best games i've played in a long while. I give it a solid 9.5/10, absolutely amazing!

review: J'avais 10 ans quand je jouais √† ce jeu sur la Xbox premi√®re du nom. Je me souviens de chaque petit d√©tail qui le composait : la musique, les effets sonores, le gameplay et surtout ces crocodiles de l'enfer ! Incarner Indy √©tait tellement palpitant. Lors des sauts ou du d√©ploiement du fouet je gesticulais dans tous les sens avec ma manette. Et la plupart du temps ... je rageais ! Bref blague √† part, ce jeu est un petit bijou sous-estim√©. Le gameplay et les graphismes sont loin d'√™tre pass√©s de mode aujourd'hui. Je ne sais pas si c'est la nostalgie qui parle mais pour moi l'immersion est l√†. J'irai m√™me jusqu'√† dire que le jeu d√©passe de loin le dernier film de la franchise, mais √ßa c'est une autre histoire. Ah oui et la cam√©ra tient la route, ce qui n'√©tait pas forc√©ment le cas de certains jeux du genre en 2003. En bref, je consid√®re ce jeu comme l'Uncharted de l'√©poque, si vous √™tes fan d'Indiana prenez-le il en vaut la peine !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040524850', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1705741339}
review:
I bought this game out of pure nostalgia alone

I remember being 4 years old, watching my dad on our original Xbox play this game through, and I only beat it myself till I was 13.
Now I'm 19, and saw this game got released on Steam, and [i]had[/i] those old memories.

This game, is one of the purest hidden gems for the Xbox Original, and is worth every penny.

Don't be afraid to install some 1080p mods, just to warn those, this game [b]Does not support modern X-input controllers[/b] It cannot read thumbstick, or trigger imputs, but thankfully the keyboard controls are pretty solid, except the camera, which has a mind of its own.


Ever wanted to kill nazis in Atlantis? Imperial China? Prague? [b]Buy this treat[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198086576557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1687767208}
review:
HOW TO GET 60 FPS

Go to your Steam directory

steamapps > common > Indiana Jones and the Emperors Tomb > GameData > Indy

Edit the vars.cfg with a text editor

Change FPS Limit = '30' to '120' (Or a number of your choosing)

Enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984228275', 'num_games_owned': 3064, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1692206983}
review:
http://www.wsgf.org/f/u/contrib/dr/29713/hacks/IndianaJones_EmperorsTomb.7z Here is higher resolutions. Very good game. Has cloud saves. Works on windows 10.

60 FPS
1 Go to <path-to-game>\GameData\indy\ 
2. Open default.cfg with a text editor 
3. Set (or add) vsyncinterval:2 

4. Go to <path-to-game>\GameData\indy\ 
5. Open vars.cfg with a text editor 
6. Change fpsLimit=30 to fpsLimit=60 
Notes: FPS over 60 may cause bugs in game.

review: Indy's fluid animations and smooth controls are impressive for the game's age. The only major compliment I have here is the illogical level design like some human enemies are placed ("trapped" fits better) in areas with no accessible paths leading to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336256389', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1542780033}
review: Is it a bit janky? Yes. Is it at times immensely frustrating? Most definetly. Does it make me relive my childhood and fill me with nostalgic giddy? Absolutely. This was one of those big games for me as a child. You know the one I mean, that one that's really irritatingly difficult as a kid but something about it kept dragging you back to it. After many attempts 7 year old me managed to beat this game and it has since secured itself a very special place in my gaming career. I don't know how the game would be for someone who doesnt have nostalgia for it, but for me theres something very unique about this game that makes it an easy recommendation if your looking for something different

author: {'steamid': '76561198066526810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1633860476}
review:
EDIT: There is a bug when I exit the game, it still says its running on steam even though its 'not'. All you need to do is end "Slayer.exe" in task manager or any other way and it will close the game properly and sync afterwards. Hope this helps, if you've come accross this issue!

The Review:

~ So i wrote this review before i installed the game, but yeah, you gotta play it first (duh) so i played it for a bit so i could post this review! P.S the game is amazing! ~

What I originally posted: I have not even intalled this game yet on Steam, but I just thought I'd get the review over with since I've played and finished the game countless times (somewhere between 5 and 11 but i can't remember) back in the good ol' days of Spyro, Crash, Burnout, Lilo and Stitch and all the legendary PS2 games that make masterpieces like Skyrim, Black Ops 1 (or any other modern day creation for that matter) look like they missed the hype train. 
Cause damn, when i saw this on Steam, not only did i start laughing (literally, don't judge me), I bought it and set it to download.

Really, its a CLASSIC or as close to one as games go. Its fun, its immersive and its worth every cent, with regards to storyline and game length. It is level and area-based and its awesome. I can go into detail about certain character developments and story progression, but nah, its a great game and its part of my gaming childhood and I highly recommend it to anyone into any game of any kind. Its so worth it (Thanks Valve for finally adding BTW)

10/10 Giant Albino Crocodiles!
99/100 Krakens! 
5/5 Chinese Ninjas!
99% Nazi Antagonists!
1000/1000 Dragon Emperors!

~ GET IT! Its better than Tomb Raider and Assassin's Creed! ~

author: {'steamid': '76561198269795661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1554400213}
review: I loved this game when I was younger, back when Lucasarts was a thing.  It's still a great game to this day, minus the dated graphics and gameplay but if you are an Indiana Jones fan, you will like this game. It captures the spirit of what an Indiana Jones game should be: adventure, puzzles, story, orchestral music (which is extraordinary for a game like this), and action. The camera is a little clunky but again, this game was made in 2003.  For its price, I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289345761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1586308080}
review:
This game was made in 2003, and yet it has more detail than most games made in 2018. The graphics may be outdated, the camera is a bit shit, the framerate cap is at a good 30 (which is fine that was the 2003 standard) and you might be playing in a bad resolution but the game is worth the buy.

RIP Lucas Arts, you will be remembered. 1982 - 2013

P.S. Thank you Disney, for bringing our childhoods back, first battlefront 2, now this. Brings a tear to my fucking eye.

In a more serious note, buy this game if you want a good time and see the father of Nathan Drake and Laura Croft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067112834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1542566880}
review:
IT'S FINALLY ON STEAM! I already gave up hope because the game was added to GOG like 2.5 years ago.
If you have never played this game, in short, this is the best Indiana Jones game ever made. I completed it a dozen times at least. Now, I want to list a few of the most remarkable things about the game.
1. Music. Ambient music is a masterpiece. Extremely atmospheric. During combat there is orchestral music, which is simply brilliant, and it means a lot from someone who hates orchestral music like me. This game is worth buying even solely for the music.
2. Combat. Platforming sections play a major role in the game, but there's nothing too exceptional about them. The combat though is incredibly enjoyable, despite being two-button and having just a few combos. That is, if you fight with fists or melee weapons. There are guns, and sometimes they are useful, but I recommend not to use them too often - the game is much more enjoyable without them.
3. Atmosphere. It's one of the most atmospheric games I've ever played, and I've played a lot, trust me. 
Also, it's worth mentioning that unlike in movies, where Indiana spent most of the time in one place, there are quite a few of different and sometimes unexpected locations. It definitely contributes to the atmosphere of adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170444981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1659067644}
review:
Eggs. Eggs set up the  filling. They give the filling its rich, luxurious texture.
Heavy cream. Heavy cream makes it luxurious and silky smooth. It‚Äôs thick, creamy, and absolutely heavenly in this recipe. I use 1 cup of heavy cream and 1/4 cup of milk. I found that 1 and 1/4 cups of heavy cream (or more) was simply too much. Too thick, too gloppy! You can also use the heavy cream to make homemade whipped cream for the topping.
Cornstarch. A starch thickener is one of the most important ingredients in a filling. I use a touch of cornstarch in my recipe because it helps set up. Makes it a little sturdier and firm, while keeping everything smooth.
Homemade pie crust (full recipe makes 2 crusts: 1 for bottom, 1 for leaf decor)
one 15oz can (about 2 cups; 450g) pumpkin puree*
3 large eggs
1 and 1/4 cups (250g) packed light or dark brown sugar
1 Tablespoon (8g) cornstarch
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 and 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground ginger*
1/4 teaspoon ground or freshly grated nutmeg*
1/8 teaspoon ground cloves*
1/8 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
1 cup (240ml) heavy cream
1/4 cup (60ml) milk (I use 1% ‚Äì any is fine)
egg wash: 1 large egg beaten with 1 Tablespoon milk

author: {'steamid': '76561198043286259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1679032095}
review:
The Best and Greatest Indiana Jones game ever made! 

Yes it's from 2003 and so the puzzles, combat and story are a little dated but I loved it 
then and still do now.

To this day, it's still the best globe-trekking, nazi killing, treasure hunting video game 
adaption of Indiana Jones ever.

Fortune and Glory to whoever put this old gem on Steam
